ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Learned about a topic I had no clue about before hand.
History of the circus, starting with it's origins in England and ending in the present day
Learned about the history of the American Circus, how to do research on the circus, the impact the circus has had on American entertainment (more than you would think!)

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths: Professor very knowledgable and it was an interesting topic.
Weakness: Really just not as fun as you would think. I quickly stopped looking forward to coming to the class. No one did the readings so there was never actual discussion. Would work better as a lecture in my opinion.

Strengths: interesting material; the guest lectures were really cool
Weaknesses: the lectures didn't seem to build on each other, and it sometimes felt like we were learning the same things over and over again

The course prevented a bevy of information that was very closely related to the topic of the circus. Unfortunately, the disappointing presentation of that information sometimes made class tedious. If active engagement became the focus of the seminar as opposed to monotonous lecturing, I think my experience would have been much better.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: No. It was not as fun as expected and it really wasn't rewarding.
I think the students who most enjoyed this course were the ones who already had a specific area of interest related to the circus
Yes! 100%! Its really fun and a great academic break from all the Yale officialdom.
Yes! Very fun and interesting class.
Grading appears to be random, no helpful comments, just a grade. And it's not an A usually. So that's odd given the lack of feedback.

I would recommend a College Seminar to anyone looking for a relatively easy class about a topic they would not be able to explore anywhere else at Yale. The American circus is an incredibly fascinating but woefully misunderstood component of turn-of-the-20th-century cultural life, and I am grateful for the opportunity to learn about it in such detail and depth.

extras.title: CSDC 380 01 - History of the American Circus
